H0.text: Swamp is the kind of environment where the Russian thistle, commonly known as the tumbleweed—a big, round plant with many branches and short, stiff leaves that spreads a large number of seeds when it breaks off from its stalk—is most likely found.

H1.text: Prairie is the environment most likely found for the Russian thistle, a big, round plant with many branches and short, stiff leaves that spreads a large number of seeds when it breaks off from its stalk.

H2.text: Forest is the type of environment where the Russian thistle, commonly known as the tumbleweed, is most likely found, given that it is a big, round plant with many branches and short, stiff leaves that spreads many seeds when it breaks off from its stalk.

H3.text: The tundra is the kind of environment where the Russian thistle, commonly known as the tumbleweed, is most likely found, as this big, round plant with many branches and short, stiff leaves spreads a large number of seeds when it breaks off from its stalk.

A4.text: Salsola tragus is a common weed of disturbed habitats

A6.text: Xerophyte tumbleweed species occur most commonly in steppe and arid ecosystems, where frequent wind and the open environment permit rolling without prohibitive obstruction.
